common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Pieces OS and Desktop App launching, updating, and connecting. Issues often occur after updates and manifest as infinite loading screens or error messages. Proposed solutions include reinstalling apps, replacing corrupted folders, checking log files, and debugging connectivity issues with support staff.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi is having issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a recent update.
* MoyinShabi is not getting any health check notifications.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue with MoyinShabi's desktop app's database.
* Unable to reproduce the inability to boot the app.
* `GetIt` package encountering an error during initialization.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces requested log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A potential bug in the `com.pieces.pfd` folder was fixed and a repaired version was provided.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* MoyinShabi replaced the `com.pieces.pfd` folder with the repaired version but the issue persists.
* An error related to the `GetIt` package is being logged.

**Additional Notes:**

* MoyinShabi is located in an area with poor network connectivity.
* mack-at-pieces was unable to fully reproduce the issue but believes the provided solution may resolve it.

**Next Steps:**

* MoyinShabi should continue to work with mack-at-pieces to troubleshoot the issue.
* mack-at-pieces may need to investigate the `GetIt` package error further.

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Download Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Ollama in Pieces OS, including installation failures due to sandbox restrictions, download problems, and unresponsive UI. Proposed solutions involve patching the app for sandbox access, updating snap dependencies, and replacing the LLM infrastructure. Temporary fixes include reinstalling Pieces OS and deleting app data.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Pieces-os is unable to install Ollama due to a lack of "curl" in the snap environment.
* User has "curl" installed but it's unavailable within the sandboxed Pieces-os environment.
* Manually downloading Ollama doesn't resolve the issue as Pieces-os cannot access it.
* The issue impacts both downloading and inference of LLMs.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces-os snap confinement restricts access to "curl" which is needed for downloading Ollama.
* Strict confinement prevents Pieces-os from seeing externally installed Ollama.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Patching the package to allow Ollama usage from within the sandbox.
* Updating the snap definition file to include "curl" as a dependency.

**Current status/outcome:**

* A fix is currently in development and expected to be released next week (as of January 23, 2025).
* Users are advised to wait for the official update.

**Additional notes:**

* Users are encouraged to check the issue for updates.
* Concerns are raised about the security implications of using cloud-based LLMs.

i want stop but its not working 

## GitHub Issue Discussion Summary: Mistral 8 7b Download Issues 

**Key points raised:**

* The "stop download" button for the Mistral 8 7b model does not work in the Pieces OS and desktop app.
* Clicking the button multiple times can lead to the model getting stuck on "Initialization".

**Problems identified:**

* This issue seems to affect multiple users and has been seen before with other models.
* No clear explanation is provided for why the issue occurs.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Temporary fix:** Delete all files in `C:/Users/[YOUR-USERNAME]/Documents/com.pieces.os/` and perform a fresh install of Pieces OS and the desktop app. This worked for one user but might not be a sustainable solution for everyone.
* Other less successful attempts included reinstalling the desktop app & OS without deleting data, reinstalling Ollama, disconnecting from the internet, and restarting the machine.
* The infrastructure for Large Language Models is being completely replaced with plans to implement this within 2-3 weeks. This could potentially resolve the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The temporary fix mentioned by AkhilTrivediX might work for some users.
* The long-term fix likely relies on the successful implementation of the new LLM infrastructure, expected within 2-3 weeks of the initial discussion.
* Further updates are necessary to confirm if the new infrastructure resolves the download issues.

recommendations: **Prioritize LTM-2 Performance Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and address the performance problems related to LTM-2, particularly high CPU usage and slowness reported by users.

**Improve Ollama Installation Process:** Review and enhance the Ollama installation process within Pieces OS to resolve issues related to sandbox restrictions, download failures, and UI responsiveness.

**Address Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch and Update Issues:** Investigate and resolve the recurring problems with Pieces OS and Desktop App launching and updating, including gray spaces in settings, OS update failures, and app launch failures.
**Enhance Communication on Known Issues:**  Keep users informed about the status and estimated resolution time for known issues, such as the LTM-2 performance problems and Ollama installation issues.
**Gather More Detailed User Feedback:** Encourage users to provide more specific details and system information when reporting issues to aid in faster troubleshooting and resolution.
**Improve Error Messaging:** Provide clearer and more informative error messages to users when issues occur, enabling them to understand the problem and potential solutions better.
**Expand Testing Coverage:** Implement more comprehensive testing procedures, including various hardware configurations and operating systems, to identify and address potential issues before release.
**Consider User Hardware Limitations:** Optimize LTM-2 and other resource-intensive features to run more efficiently on lower-end hardware configurations to prevent performance issues.
**Review Sandbox Permissions:** Evaluate the sandbox permissions for Pieces OS to ensure necessary access for functionalities like Ollama installation while maintaining security.
**Provide Troubleshooting Guides:** Create and maintain comprehensive troubleshooting guides for common issues, empowering users to resolve problems independently when possible.
